These two hymns, both in oblique tones, are thus chanted together as one. The third circumambulation begins with bowing low and reverently contemplating the Most High, chanting to the final line, then together intoning the sound of praise, each bowing once—this completes the dawn audience. The remaining six hymns are distributed within the noon and evening audiences, one hymn chanted per circumambulation. Thus, the ten hymns are fully completed within the three audiences, conforming to the proper rite for the full recitation of the *Yujing Shan* during the court audience.

When chanting the *Step-Void Hymns*, should even one hymn be omitted, at the moment of ascending the altar to present the court audience and offer prayers, the sincerity of the heart may falter, making it difficult to be witnessed by the august and lofty perfected ones. In all ritual feasts, when ascending the altar to perform the Dao, it is only during the circumambulation and court audience of *Yujing Shan* that one must visualize the golden towers and jade palaces, beholding the sacred countenance of the deities. Only then may one pray for blessings and grace, dispel death and deliver life.

What we now observe in the transmission of the immortal elders is the very voice of Master Zheng. It is meant to be passed down to later generations, that they may follow the prescribed form. Having beheld what is recorded in the scriptures, how could one keep it sealed away? With reverence, it is carved into printing blocks to be shared with all. One must cultivate utmost devotion, casting aside all doubt, that one may receive the protection of the sages and together partake in blessings and fortune.

**Radiant and Luminous**
Radiant and luminous, soaring high,
The ancestral breeze traverses the mysterious.
The Primal Beginning unfolds the circle,
Dispersing the five chapters.
The vermilion script of the sacred register,
Enwrapped by yellow clouds on four sides.
The eight mights stand guard,
Spirit beasts attend the perfected.
Resplendent light adorns the hair,
Reflected incense brushes away dust.
The embroidered confluence stretches long,
Circumambulating past the ten heavens.
Chanting aloud the *Kongdong*,
Treading the *zheng*-step into the profound.
Withered souls ascend to yang,
Ashen bones return to humanity.
The spirit sovereign delivers destiny,
Riding the void, mounting the mist.
In reverent recitation of the *Dong* chapters,
One’s years equal the kalpas.

Above: *Radiant and Luminous* and *Ancestral Office*—the *Dao Sutra of the Heavenly Thearch* from the *Kongdong* sacred hymns. Each of the thirty-two heavens has its own hymn, some in four-character lines, others in five. See the *Kongdong* sacred hymns in the *Dongyuan* section of the *Lingbao* canon.

**Hymn of Upholding the Precepts**
The Dao is the heartless origin,
All things become fields of merit.
Establishing merit has no fixed lord,
Each vow arises from the person.
Emptying the self to respond to sentient beings,
An open heart leaves none unequal.
The great sages exalt the supreme teaching,
Just as rain falls from the heavens.
Lofty peaks embrace all without exception,
Yet the humble become profound.
The sea is king of a hundred rivers,
For it can forsake dragons and scales.
Through ten thousand kalpas, wisdom is preserved—
How could it be limited to one’s own years?

**Hymn of Upholding the Precepts (continued)**
To uphold the precepts without momentary lapse,
Life after life, good affinities are formed.
With focused thought, one contemplates the Great Vehicle—
In time, the truth of the Dao shall be embodied.

**Three Invocations, Three Praises**
Delight in the Dharma as one’s spouse,
Cherish the scriptures as pearls and jade.
Uphold the precepts to restrain the six senses,
Contemplate the Dao to dispel desires.
In tranquility, the upright qi abides;
In serenity, the spirit is still and silent.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
Life after life, great blessings are received.
Flourishing are the household and kingdom,
Prospering are the scriptures and the Dao.
Heavenly beings share this vow,
In subtle realms, one enters the Great Vehicle.
From the heart, fields of merit are established,
As the Dharma wheel ascends in boundless ascent.
Seven generations ascend to the heavens,
While this body soars in broad daylight.
The great Dao abides in the profound void—
With thought, none fails to align.
Refining the form to join the immortals,
One attains the adamantine body.
Transcending the three realms’ trials,
The five sufferings of hell are dissolved.
All return to the Supreme Scriptures,
In silent contemplation, bowing in reverence.

**Invocation for the Hall**
To cultivate the Dao, one must be steadfast and resolute,
Gathering faith to refine sincerity.
Burning incense, one turns to the Supreme,
True qi mingles with fragrant smoke.
May the great abundance be revealed,
That seven generations depart the dark underworld.

**Hymn of the Ritual Fast**
The Dao takes fasting as its foremost practice,
Through diligent observance, one ascends the golden portals.

Thus is the great Dharma Bridge established,
To universally ferry all beings and creatures.
Repaying the kindness and virtue of past lives,
The Dao-heart arises in transcendent clarity.
The body soars to the Mystic Capital,
And the seven ancestors all attain liberation.

**Hymn of Great Learning for Immortality**
To learn immortality, sever all ornate thoughts,
Each念 intertwines and accumulates.
Coming and going disturb my spirit,
With restless agitation, nothing remains unscathed.
Diminish thoughts, still the void and leisure,
In desolate emptiness, enter profound silence.
Seek the scriptures as if parched with thirst,
Hold resolve firm as metal and stone.
Preserve the child to traverse the Mystic Path,
The Five Spirits bestow the registers of passage.

**Hymn of Lesser Learning for Immortality**
To learn immortality, action is urgent,
Uphold the precepts to restrain the heart’s passions.
In emptiness and equanimity, the true qi resides,
Where immortals and sages naturally converge.
If one does not trust the Dharma’s words,
Why dwell in the mountains and forests?

**Hymn of the Burning Petition**
The worlds of humans and gods abound in obstacles,
Yet the great Dao truly pities and cherishes.
Salvation and deliverance extend through teachings and disciplines,
All are enabled to repent their karmic entanglements.
Transgressions fill the earthly courts,
Offenses have reached the heavens.
Revealing all, one prays for the true ones’ protection,
With a serene heart, one moves the sages and worthies.
Reverently bowing to the Three Treasures,
May one attain longevity and long years.
The burning petition ascends to the upper realms,
Names are presented before the Jade Emperor.

**Mountain Petition**
Praying to the true ones, one ascends the Purple Peak,
Presenting one’s mandate at the sacred mountain.
Jade maidens sway with the sound of Sanskrit,
Golden lads offer fragrant incense.
Names are inscribed to penetrate the nine earths,
Characters are arrayed to ascend the three heavens.
May one eternally enjoy boundless life,
And accomplish the loftiest immortality.

**Water Petition**
The Heavenly Worthy left the precepts,
The Most High expounded the true scriptures.
To uphold the Dharma, one must be diligent in resolve,
Merit and virtue treasure the spirit’s essence.
With reverent heart, invoke the Three Treasures,
Burn incense to announce to the hundred spirits.
Inscribe names and cast them into the water府,
Meritorious deeds reach the Supreme Clarity.
The Heavenly Worthy left the great Dharma,
To broadly deliver those in the dark underworld.
When the merit of the fast is complete,
The Dragon Petition announces to the spring courts.
The seven ancestors all attain liberation,
Myriad blessings naturally converge.
Inscribe names and cast them into the water府,
Meritorious deeds reach the Supreme Clarity.

**Earth Petition**
The merit of the fast is accomplished,
The talismanic mandate announces at the sacred altar.
Jade tablets inscribe sincere devotion,
Golden dragons swiftly transmit the pledge.
With reverent heart, one gazes toward the Central府,
Returning life to the Yellow Circle.
In life and death, all find joy,
And shall meet to bow before the celestial countenance.
The Crimson Radiance unfolds the Primordial Chart,
Harmonious yang communicates with the upper spirits.
Jade mounds adorn the jasper palaces,
Myriad traversals, the Dao naturally dwells.
Without the Yellow Register Petition,
How could the roots of suffering be eradicated?
Circumambulating, recite the Cavern Chapters,
The Five Clouds naturally support one another.
Aligning and controlling, one opens the Mystic Ultimate,
Riding the current to enter the Central Heaven.
Unveiling the void, one offers the treasure of the heart,
Subtly cultivating the field of the body.
From the Solar Palace, harmonious qi disperses,
In the vast courtyard, the smoke of vows ascends.
The Earth Petition is beyond comprehension,
Bestowing blessings and grace without limit.
The Primordial Beginning transmitted the disciplinary teachings,
The lofty perfected expounded the Cavern Spirits.
Cinnabar writings radiate resplendent light,
Jade characters inscribe the spirit’s essence.
With reverent heart, invoke the Nine Heavens,
Through the fast, reach the myriad spirits.
Inscribe names and cast them into the earth府,
The body ascends to pay homage in the Jade Clarity.

**Hymn of Wisdom**
Wisdom arises from the primordial beginning,
Bright and luminous, it transcends the ten directions.
Weaving the void, it stands in the Mystic Empyrean,
All heavens draw from its flowing fragrance.
Its wonders are beyond comprehension,
Through emptiness, true and real communicate.
Being is ultimately non-being,
Non-being is not without non-being.
Wisdom constantly observes the body,
It is the foremost in learning the Dao.
In subtle subtlety, it roams the Mystic Expanse,
Naturally recording my spirit.
The Heavenly Worthy ever protects and shelters,
The demon kings pledge their guardianship.
Resplendent is the adamantine body,
Transcending all before the Most High.
Wisdom engenders the root of precepts,
The true Dao takes precepts as its master.
The Three Treasures arise from this,
Bestowed by the lofty immortals.
Boarding this deathless vessel,
Swiftly cross the great abundance.
At this moment of expounding the precepts,
All heavens bow in reverence.

**Hymn of Bathing in the Eastern Well**
The Celestial River pours into the Eastern Well,
Stone radiance and the Water Mother’s essence.
Circular light brushes the numinous brilliance,
Mystic reflections gleam with lofty clarity.
The Primordial Beginning parts the heavy night,
Heavenly beings follow the moon’s birth.
Bathing atop the Orchid Pond,
Dragons bear the long-handled vase.
Golden lads sprinkle fragrant water,
Jade maidens stream the Five Stars.
Crowns and sashes gleam with jade essence,
Refining and delivering the Five Immortals’ forms.
The body fragrant, myriad spirits descend,
Grasping the radiance, one ascends to lofty clarity.

**Incantation of the Pure Water for Delivering Souls**
Majestic is the Dao and its virtue,
Meritorious deeds have reached completion.
Descending to receive and guide,
The Precious Master naturally accompanies.
Compassionate and merciful, bestow the Dharma water,
To wash away delusion and ignorance.
Eternally deliver to the Three Clarities’ shores,
Forever departing the Five Turbidities’ mire.

**Hymn of the Six Heavenly Penetrations**
The six penetrations of the heavenly perfected,
Those who cultivate goodness.
For all these sentient beings,
Expound the teachings without shame.
The Heavenly Worthy’s secret words,
At this time are heard and expounded.
Faithfully accepting, each returns to refuge,
Bowing to the Supreme Worthy.

**Hymn of Rebirth for Refining and Deliverance**
The vicissitudes turn like a wheel,
The camphor tree’s branches remain unchanged.
With a tranquil heart, contemplate the utmost truth,
Follow the current, comply with separation and union.
Constantly recite the jade chapters,
Mystic sounds pierce the clouds and rosy dawn.
Eternally enjoy boundless time,
How could one know the multitude of kalpas?

**Hymn of Metal and Wood**
Fusang initiates the numinous movement,
Metal and wood sprout verdant buds.
Wondrously, the Golden Mother flows,
Harmonizing the natural blossoms.
Spiritual qi congeals in the Primordial Palace,
Numinous beings radiate crimson rosy clouds.
Naturally attaining the human Dao,
Names are recorded in the immortals’ lineage.

**Three Verses of the Vermilion Mound, Yellow Flower, and Great Unity**
To the south, the Vermilion Mound府,
In the Cinnabar Heaven, flames flow through the courtyard.
Jade eyes refine the bodily form,
Instantly returning to life.
Great Sage, Jade-Eyed Refiner of Forms, Heavenly Worthy.

In the Eastern Well’s Yellow Flower Pool,
Stone radiance and the Water Mother’s essence.
Yellow flowers sway the soul and form,
Instantly renewing life.
Great Sage, Yellow Flower Swaying Forms, Heavenly Worthy.

In the Eastern Ultimate’s Realm of Eternal Joy,
The Azure Flower is called the Court of Blessings.
Following the sound, deliver the suffering souls,
Instantly departing to be reborn.
Great Sage, Great Unity Deliverer of Suffering, Heavenly Worthy.

**Seven-Character Ancient Verse for Scattering Flowers**
The Southern Dipper glistens, the Northern Dipper shifts,
All stars shine brilliantly, the moon’s radiance gleams.
The Primordial Beginning transmitted words, all receive the registers,
The Dao Lord opened the teachings, all return to refuge.
In the Lesser Existence Grotto, the thousand-year herbs,
On the Jade Capital Mountain, the ten-thousand-year peaches.
At the Nine Dragons’ Gate, the perfected saints gather,
By the Eight Immortals’ Terrace, the void-traversing hymns resound.
Three Perfected Jade Maidens hold the flower scepters,
A pair of lads bear the golden censers.
Moon mantles with pearls strung through nine-colored cords,
Cloud robes fragrant, permeating the six-pound hems.

chunks.original_text: 五言散花 逸辔登紫清，元乘迈奔电。 阆风三天，俯视犹可见。 玉闼摽敞朗，琼林郁葱蒨。 自非挺金骨，焉得谐夙愿。 真明何森森，合景恣游宴。 良会忘淹留，千龄才一盻。 三宫发明景，朗照同郁仪。 纷然驰飙欻，上采空清蕤。 令我洞金色，后天耀琼姿。 心协太虚静，寥寥竟何思。 玄中有至乐，淡泊终无为。 但与正真友，飘飖散遨嬉。 禀化凝正炁，炼形为真仙。 志心符元宗，返本叶自然。 帝一集终宫，流光出丹玄。 元英与桃君，朗咏长生篇。 百关罗紫烟，飙车涉寥廓。 靡靡八景迂，不觉云路远，斯须游方天。 扶桑诞初景，羽盖凌晨霞。 倏欻造西域，嬉游金母家。 碧津湛洪源，灼烁敷荷花。 煌煌青琳宫，灿灿列玉华。 真炁溢绛府，自然思无邪。 俯矜区中士，天浊良可嗟。 琼台劫为仞，孤映大罗表。 常有三素云，凝光自飞达。 羽童泛明霞，升降何缥缈。 鸾凤吹雅音，栖翔绛林标。 玉虚无昼夜，灵景何皎皎。 一绪太上京，方知众天小。 灼灼青华林，灵风振琼柯。 三光无冬春，一炁青且和。 回首迩结璘，倾眸亲曜罗。 豁落制六天，流铃威百魔。 绵绵庆不极，谁谓椿龄多。 高情无侈靡，遇物生华光。 至乐无箫歌，金玉音琅琅。 或登明真台，宴此羽景堂。 杳霭结玉云，霏微散灵香。 天人诚遐旷，欢泰不可量。 爰从太微上，肆觐虚皇尊。 腾我八景舆，威迟入天门。 既登玉晨庭，肃肃仰紫轩。 敢问龙汉末，如何辟乾坤。 怡然辍云傲，告我布夷言。 幸闻至精理，方见造化源。 二炁播万有，化机无停轮。 而我操其端，乃能出陶钧。 寥寥大漠上，所遇皆清真。 澄莹含元和，炁同自相亲。 绛树结丹实，紫霞流碧津。 以兹保童婴，永用超形神。 宋真宗制玉清昭应宫散花词十首 散花何处最花多，天上高天有大罗。 花在此中生本异，况将瑞露庆云和。 昆丘绝顶有龟台，台上奇花四序开。 不是群仙朝玉帝，何由得到世间来。 天上天花旦夕开，不同人世待春来。 天花每有天人折，将献层城日几回。 瑶台光夜露华滋，月帔朝真在此时。 时有仙花空裹降，吹来玉宇奉金姿。 五色华花降洞天，仰观空裹势翩翩。 莫言仙镜常时有，动是人寰亿万年。 仙花折得自仙宫，散在珍台晓景中。 玉阙有春春不老，璇图受福福无穷。 羽客骖鸾在半天，下瞻真馆意乾乾。 蓬莱折得花无数，散在殊庭黼座前。 上林花卉先春发，幽谷莺声尚未知。 不遣常人攀折得，尽将福地奉真期。 洞中三十六天春，仙境由来异世人。 采得名花何处去，将来宫殿奉高真。 仙官真倡往还频，互看蓬莱阆苑春。 每采芳花朝上帝，愿均福地及生民。 太极太虚真人歌三涂五苦颂八首 三才及万物，倚伏各有龄。 终始待劫数，福尽天地倾。 往返於五道，苦哉更死生。 展转三途中，去来与祸并。 大贤慎兹戒，忍性念割情。 愚夫不信法，罪痛常自婴。 吾念世无已，今故重告明。 若欲度斯祸，归命太上经。 罪福不由它，谅自发尔身。 大贤故闭口，欲绝诸恶绿。 灭念归兼志，倚伏待长泯。 弘道以安世，终当见其真。 媱嫉为祸首，灭身之至患。 含养知此辈，恐必致夭残。 知恶而不革，岂是道所安。 怀毒日斋直，令我发长叹。 宿命有信然，弱丧谓之无。 皆欲眼前见。 过目则言悠。

**Five-Character Verse for Scattering Flowers**

Light reins ascend the Purple Clarity,
Primal steed outpaces racing lightning.
From the three heavens of Langfeng,
Gazing down—still visible below.

Jade gates gleam in boundless radiance,
Jasper groves flourish in lush verdure.
Without tempered bones of gold,
How could one fulfill long-cherished vows?

True brightness, how vast and deep,
Merged with light, we roam and feast.
This rare gathering forgets time’s passage,
A thousand years but a single glance.

The Three Palaces emit bright effulgence,
Shining as one with the luminous canopy.
Swiftly the whirlwind carries us,
Upward to pluck the void’s pure blossoms.

Granting me a golden-hued cavern,
Beyond heaven, my jade form gleams.
My heart aligns with the Great Void’s stillness,
In boundless emptiness—what thoughts remain?

Within the mysterious lies supreme joy,
In tranquil non-action, perfect ease.
Only with the truly orthodox as friends,
We drift and soar in carefree play.

Receiving transformation, we condense pure qi,
Refining form to become true immortals.
With wholehearted devotion, we align with the Primal Source,
Returning to the root, harmonizing with nature.

The Supreme Unity gathers in the Final Palace,
Streaming light from the Cinnabar Mystery.
Yuan Ying and Peach Lord,
Recite the Ode of Eternal Life.

A hundred passages wreathed in purple mist,
The whirlwind chariot traverses the vast expanse.
Gently the Eight Radiant Realms unfold,
Unnoticed, the cloud-path stretches far—
In an instant, we wander the Four Heavens.

Fusang births the first light,
Feathered canopies greet the dawn’s glow.
In a flash, we arrive in the Western Realm,
Frolicking in the Golden Mother’s abode.

Azure streams brim with boundless source,
Glowing, they unfold the lotus blooms.
Resplendent the Azure Jasper Palace,
Dazzling, the arrayed jade blossoms.

True qi overflows the Crimson Palace,
Naturally, thoughts remain free of wrong.
Looking down in pity upon mortals,
How turbid the world—truly lamentable!

The Jasper Terrace stands a kalpa’s height,
Solitary, it gleams beyond the Great Veil.
Ever present, the Three Pure Clouds,
Their congealed light soars freely.

Feathered youths drift on bright mist,
Ascending and descending—how ethereal!
Phoenixes and simurghs sound refined melodies,
Perching and soaring in the crimson forest’s peaks.

The Jade Void knows no day or night,
How radiant the numinous light!
One thread leads to the Supreme Capital,
Only then do all heavens seem small.

Glowing, the Azure Flower Grove,
Divine winds stir the jasper branches.
The Three Luminaries know no winter or spring,
One qi—verdant and harmonious.

Turning back, the near ones form a radiant cluster,
Gazing afar, we draw close to the shining web.
Vast and unbounded, we govern the Six Heavens,
Streaming bells subdue the hundred demons.

Endless, the blessings flow unceasing,
Who says the cedar’s age is long?
Lofty sentiments shun excess,
Encountering all things, they birth radiant splendor.

Supreme joy needs no flute or song,
Gold and jade resound in melodious tones.
Now ascending the Terrace of Bright Perfection,
We feast in the Hall of Feathered Splendor.

Misty vapors weave jade clouds,
Subtle fragrance scatters, divine incense wafts.
Heavenly beings, truly distant and vast,
Their joy and peace beyond measure.

From the Supreme Tenuity above,
We hasten to behold the Venerable Sovereign of the Void.
Lifting my Eight Radiant Chariot,
Majestically we enter the Heavenly Gate.

Having ascended the Jade Dawn Court,
Reverently we gaze upon the Purple Portal.
Dare I ask of the Dragon Han’s end,
How was the cosmos opened?

Joyfully setting aside cloud-borne pride,
He reveals to me the words of Yu Yi:
“Fortunate to hear the essence of the utmost truth,
Only now do I see the source of creation.

The Two Qi propagate the ten thousand beings,
The mechanism of transformation knows no rest.
Yet I grasp its beginning,
Thus able to transcend the potter’s wheel.

In the vast desert of emptiness,
All I encounter are the pure and true.
Limpid and lustrous, containing primordial harmony,
Qi naturally draws together in kinship.

Crimson trees bear cinnabar fruit,
Purple mists flow through azure streams.
With this, we preserve the Divine Infant,
Forever transcending form and spirit.”

---

**Ten Scattering Flowers Verses Composed by Emperor Zhenzong of Song for the Jade Clarity Radiant Response Palace**

Where does one scatter flowers most abundantly?
In heaven above, the Highest Heaven of Great Veil.
Flowers here grow from a different root,
Bathed in auspicious dew and harmonious clouds.

Atop the Kunlun’s peak stands the Tortoise Terrace,
Where wondrous flowers bloom through all four seasons.
Were it not for the assembled immortals paying homage to the Jade Emperor,
How could they reach the mortal world?

Heavenly flowers bloom day and night,
Unlike the world below, awaiting spring’s return.
Each time heavenly beings pluck them,
How often are they offered to the Tiered City?

The Jasper Terrace glows in night’s dewy splendor,
As moon-mantled immortals pay homage at dawn.
At times, celestial flowers descend from the void,
Blown into jade halls, presenting golden forms.

Five-colored blossoms descend upon the Grotto-Heaven,
Gazing upward, their flight through the void is graceful.
Say not that immortal mirrors are ever-present,
For in the mortal realm, they appear but once in myriad ages.

Plucked from the immortal palace,
Scattered upon the jeweled terrace in dawn’s light.
The Jade Tower knows eternal spring,
The Celestial Chart receives boundless fortune.

Feathered adepts ride simurghs in mid-heaven,
Looking down upon the true abodes with earnest hearts.
From Penglai, countless flowers are gathered,
Scattered before the embroidered thrones of the sacred precincts.

The flowers of the Supreme Grove bloom before spring,
The orioles of secluded valleys remain unaware.
Not permitting ordinary folk to pluck them,
All are offered to the blessed lands to honor the true rites.

Within the grotto, thirty-six heavens know spring,
Immortal realms differ from the world of men.
Where do the gathered blossoms go?
Brought to the palaces to honor the exalted perfected.

Immortal officials and true singers come and go frequently,
Gazing upon Penglai and Lang Garden’s spring.
Each time they pluck fragrant flowers to offer the Emperor,
May the blessed lands’ fortune extend to all living beings.

---

**Eight Hymns of Praise for the Three Paths and Five Sufferings by the Perfected of the Supreme Ultimate and Great Void**

The Three Powers and the ten thousand things,
Interdependent, each has its span.
Beginning and end await the kalpa’s reckoning,
When fortune is exhausted, heaven and earth collapse.

Traversing the Five Paths,
How bitter—repeated death and rebirth!
Turning through the Three Realms,
Coming and going with calamity.

The great wise heed this warning,
Enduring nature, contemplating the severance of desire.
Foolish men do not believe the Dharma,
Their sins and pains ever cling to them.

I grieve that the world’s suffering knows no end,
Thus I earnestly proclaim this truth anew:
If you wish to escape this calamity,
Take refuge in the Supreme Scriptures.

Sin and fortune arise not from elsewhere,
They surely spring from your own being.
The great wise thus seal their lips,
Seeking to extinguish all evil roots.

Extinguishing thoughts, uniting will,
Interdependence awaits ultimate dissolution.
Expounding the Dao to pacify the world,
In the end, one shall perceive its truth.

Envy and jealousy are the root of calamity,
The greatest peril to one’s existence.
Knowing and nurturing such types,
I fear they will surely meet early ruin.

Recognizing evil yet not reforming,
How can this bring peace to the Dao?
Harboring poison while feigning uprightness,
It makes me sigh deeply.

The certainty of past lives is undeniable,
Yet the weak and lost call it nonexistent.
All desire to see it before their eyes,
But once past, they dismiss it as distant.

chunks.translated_text:
The great wise illuminate the Dao’s teachings,
Grieving with sorrow for the stubborn and foolish.
Tenderly they ponder the suffering of such beings,
Diligently they cause me deep concern.

Human life wears away to nothing,
Like a flame consuming lamp oil.
The Four Elements briefly converge,
The Five Aggregates provisionally lend form.

In the prime of youth, one ought to study diligently,
Striving to preserve one’s self and soul.
When fortune is exhausted, body and spirit scatter,
Plunging into the dark depths of hell.

The supreme sages, fearing this fate,
Seek the Dao to escape such calamity.
The pursuit of immortality is urgent,
Observing precepts to master the heart’s passions.

Where emptiness and equanimity dwell,
The primal qi abides in rectitude,
And immortals and sages naturally gather.

If you do not trust these sacred words,
Why not retreat to the mountains and forests?
The great wise delight in scriptures and precepts,
Receiving them as treasures for the body.

To embark on study is ever deemed too late,
To cultivate the self is ever rued as too tardy.
By the time one unravels profound mysteries,
In a fleeting instant, the years have aged them.
Clutching the scroll, they sigh in utmost despair,
Soon to face the agony of death’s torment.

Thus, in my youthful years,
I abandoned the world to study the Dao.

Washing away the dust of the mundane.
May all who partake
Contemplate the Dao and ponder the True.

Reverently dedicated to praying for the emperor’s infinite longevity,
And the everlasting stability of the imperial reign.

For the supreme karmic conditions, we invoke:
The Great Sage and Primordial Heavenly Worthy,
The Most High and Great Dao Lord,
The Most High and Lord Lao,
And the immeasurable, inconceivable merits.

Let each person reverently bow,

All fields of merit begin with the offering of food.
Those present enjoy bliss, those departed ascend to heaven.
In the Pure Land to come, clothing and sustenance arise naturally.
Thus, we make offerings universally to all the heavens.
From the fragrant kitchen, exquisite offerings are made:
Above, to the Heavenly Worthies;
In the middle, to the Perfected Sages;
Below, to all sentient beings—
All are universally revered.
Blessings flow to the patron of this ritual feast,
Like rivers returning to the sea.

Upon the conclusion of the feast, intone the Heavenly Worthy’s name as before.
Recite the Incantation for Almsgiving, then rise and proclaim:

The sea of inconceivable meritorious power,
Vast and boundless, Supreme Honored One.
Responding to the resonance, hastening to the ritual site at the sound’s call,
You witness this feast of boundless goodness.

The immeasurable meritorious causes of this ritual feast,
Now dedicated in prayer for the patron, [Name],
May your body enjoy health and peace,
Your rank ascend in glory,
And through all time,
May fortune and felicity attend you.

We humbly pray that the merits of this feast be recorded,
And the fruits of the Dao sustain your being.
May you attain the longevity of the tortoise and crane,
And be blessed with the vast fortune of the great Peng.
For these supreme karmic conditions,
We invoke the boundless Heavenly Worthy of Salvation for All,
Whose inconceivable merit knows no bounds.

The five-cloud chariot turns back,
Soaring through the nine heavens in song.
In an instant, it ascends far into the sky,
While the ritual altar brims with fragrant qi.
Mysterious grace pervades the cosmos,
Blessings and fortune fill the mountains and rivers.
Gazing afar at the path of immortals,
Freely they roam atop the Great Loftiness.

Swift as the flying teal, they tread upon cloud-shoes.
Ascending, they step upon the Ninefold Mystery Altar.
With intent, they wander the Three Realms,
Riding the winds between the Five Han.
May this single footprint now
Soar and tread to meet the Golden Countenance.

**Star Crown**
Resplendent, the Seven-Star Crown gleams,
Drifting down from Heaven.
Bestowed by sacred decree,
Destined for immortals by past lives.
May this single donning now
Forever preserve the great camphorwood years.

**Daoist Skirt**
Six panels of wondrous skirts,
Adorning the celestial beings’ feathered robes.
Flying skirts grace the jeweled hall,
Gentle sashes step upon golden courts.
May this single girding now
Ethereally ascend to the Jasper Pool.

**Cloud Sleeves**
Radiant, the pure cloud sleeves,
Encompassing the upper and lower robes.
Woven from Fusang silkworms,
Still bearing the fragrance of the Moon Palace.
May this single donning now
Adorn the body for feasts in jade chambers.

**Feathered Robes**
The raiment of divine immortals above,
The celestial guests’ natural garments.
Light as the six-zhu wonder,
Adorned to match the Three Luminaries.
May this single donning now
Freely roam the land of undying.

**Bowing at the Altar**
Three tiers rise upon jasper steps,
Eight trigrams arrayed at each corner.
Skirt and mantle dispel defilement,
Hems guard the Dharma from dust.
May this single ascent now
Attend the morning rites at the Lord-on-High’s abode.

**Morning Tablet**
Flawless jade from the Western Terrace,
Polished to serve the Three August Ones.
Its upright form dispels wayward thoughts,
Holding the heart to invoke the Supreme.
May this single grasp now
Ascend the jasper stairs to worship the Void Sovereign.
